Operation 'travelimpactmodel.flights.computeFlightEmissions' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary was missing entirely. Description, while comprehensive, lacked clarity on inputs expected and outputs returned, making it difficult for AI agents to determine when to use this operation. Added concise summary describing the core action. Enhanced description to explicitly state: (1) what inputs are required (flight legs with specific identifiers), (2) batch processing capability and limits, (3) what outputs are returned (FlightWithEmissions objects with emissions per seating class), (4) graceful handling of missing estimates, and (5) error conditions. This improves AI agent interpretability by clarifying the operation's contract and when it should be invoked.

data.current_description: Stateless method to retrieve emission estimates. Details on how emission estimates are computed: https://github.com/google/travel-impact-model The response will contain all entries that match the input flight legs, in the same order. If there are no estimates available for a certain flight leg, the response will return the flight leg object with empty emission fields. The request will still be considered successful. Reasons for missing emission estimates include: * The flight is unknown to the server. * The input flight leg is missing one or more identifiers. * The flight date is in the past. * The aircraft type is not supported by the model. * Missing seat configuration. The request can contain up to 1000 flight legs. If the request has more than 1000 direct flights, if will fail with an INVALID_ARGUMENT error.
data.summary_suggestion: Compute carbon emission estimates for flights
data.description_suggestion: Computes carbon emission estimates for one or more direct flight legs. This stateless operation accepts a batch of flight requests (up to 1000 flights per request) and returns emission estimates for each flight in the same order as provided. Each flight leg should include origin/destination airports, departure date, and aircraft type. The response includes FlightWithEmissions objects containing emission data per passenger across different seating classes. If emission estimates cannot be computed for a flight leg (e.g., unknown flight, missing identifiers, past date, unsupported aircraft, or missing seat configuration), the response returns the flight leg with empty emission fields but the request succeeds. Requests exceeding 1000 flights will fail with an INVALID_ARGUMENT error. See https://github.com/google/travel-impact-model for model computation details.
data.reasoning: Original summary was missing entirely. Description, while comprehensive, lacked clarity on inputs expected and outputs returned, making it difficult for AI agents to determine when to use this operation. Added concise summary describing the core action. Enhanced description to explicitly state: (1) what inputs are required (flight legs with specific identifiers), (2) batch processing capability and limits, (3) what outputs are returned (FlightWithEmissions objects with emissions per seating class), (4) graceful handling of missing estimates, and (5) error conditions. This improves AI agent interpretability by clarifying the operation's contract and when it should be invoked.
